titles.ar: باب الْمُصَلِّي يَعْرِضُ لَهُ شَيْ‏ءٌ مِنَ الْهَوَامِّ فَيَقْتُلُهُ
titles.en: Chapter 47 – The praying one, something from the insects presents itself to him, so he kills it

titles.ar: باب بِنَاءِ الْمَسَاجِدِ وَ مَا يُؤْخَذُ مِنْهَا وَ الْحَدَثِ فِيهَا مِنَ النَّوْمِ وَ غَيْرِهِ
titles.en: Chapter 48 – Construction of the Masjid, and what can be taken from it, and the breaking of the ablution inside it due to sleep or something else

titles.ar: باب التَّسْلِيمِ عَلَى الْمُصَلِّي وَ الْعُطَاسِ فِي الصَّلَاةِ
titles.en: Chapter 46 – The greetings upon the praying one, and the sneezing during the Salāt

titles.ar: باب الْمُصَلِّي يَعْرِضُ لَهُ شَيْ‏ءٌ مِنَ الْهَوَامِّ فَيَقْتُلُهُ
titles.en: Chapter 47 – The praying one, something from the insects presents itself to him, so he kills it

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (15/241)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ قَالَ

text: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) عَنِ الرَّجُلِ يَكُونُ فِي الصَّلَاةِ فَيَرَى الْحَيَّةَ أَوِ الْعَقْرَبَ يَقْتُلُهُمَا إِنْ آذَيَاهُ قَالَ نَعَمْ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Hammad, from Hareyz, from Muhammad Bin Muslim who said,
‘I asked Abu Abdullahasws about the man who happens to be in the Salāt, so he sees the snake or the scorpion. Can he kill these two if they harm him?’ Heasws said: ‘Yes’.
en.sarwar: 1. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad, from Hammad from Hariz from Muhammad ibn Muslim who has said the following: “I once asked abu ’Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about a man who in Salah (prayer) sees a snake or scorpion; can he kill it if it is hurting? He (the Imam) said, ’Yes, he can do so.”’

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (15/242)

parts.text: أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فِي الرَّجُلِ يَقْتُلُ الْبَقَّةَ
الذُّبَابَ فِي الصَّلَاةِ أَ يَنْقُضُ صَلَاتَهُ

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عُثْمَانَ عَنِ الْحَلَبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فِي الرَّجُلِ يَقْتُلُ الْبَقَّةَ وَ الْبُرْغُوثَ وَ الْقَمْلَةَ وَ الذُّبَابَ فِي الصَّلَاةِ أَ يَنْقُضُ صَلَاتَهُ وَ وُضُوءَهُ قَالَ

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Hammad Bin Usman, from Al Halby,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullahasws regarding the man who kills the bug, and the flea, and the lice, and the fly during the Salāt. Would it break his Salāt and his ablution?’ Heasws said: ‘No’.
en.sarwar: 2. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from Hammad ibn ‘Uthman from al-Halabiy who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about a man who kills, a bug, flea, lice or a fly while in Salah (prayer), does it invalidate his Salah (prayer) and Wudu’? He (the Imam) said, ’No, it does not do so.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: موثق - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (15/242)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ وَ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ عَنْ عُثْمَانَ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ سَمَاعَةَ قَالَ

text: سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ الرَّجُلِ يَكُونُ قَائِماً فِي الصَّلَاةِ الْفَرِيضَةِ فَيَنْسَى كِيسَهُ أَوْ مَتَاعاً يَتَخَوَّفُ ضَيْعَتَهُ أَوْ هَلَاكَهُ قَالَ يَقْطَعُ صَلَاتَهُ وَ يُحْرِزُ مَتَاعَهُ ثُمَّ يَسْتَقْبِلُ الصَّلَاةَ قُلْتُ فَيَكُونُ فِي الْفَرِيضَةِ فَتَفَلَّتُ عَلَيْهِ دَابَّةٌ أَوْ تَفَلَّتُ دَابَّتُهُ فَيَخَافُ أَنْ تَذْهَبَ أَوْ يُصِيبَ مِنْهَا عَنَتاً فَقَالَ لَا بَأْسَ بِأَنْ يَقْطَعَ صَلَاتَهُ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, and Muhammad Bin Al Husayn, from Usman Bin Isa, from Sama’at who said,

‘I asked himasws about the man who happens to be standing in the Obligatory Salāt, so he remembers his bad or his provisions, fearing its wastage or its destruction. Heasws said: ‘He can cut off his Salāt and protect his belongings. Then he should re-commence the Salāt’. I said, ‘Supposing he happens to be in the Obligatory (Salāt), and an animal flees, or his animal flees, so he fears that it would go away or he would suffer hardship due to it’. So heasws said: ‘There is no problem with if he were to cut off his Salāt’.
en.sarwar: 3. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from and Muhammad ibn al-Husayn from ‘Uthman ibn ‘Isa from Sama‘ah who has said the following: “I once asked him (the Imam), ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about a man who is standing in obligatory Salah (prayer) when he remembers his bag or property and he is afraid of loss or destruction of such items. He (the Imam) said, ‘He can discontinue his Salah (prayer) to secure such items then perform his Salah (prayer) again.’ I then asked him (the Imam), ‘What happens if he is in obligatory Salah (prayer) when a stumper (animal) or his stumper escapes and he is afraid of its getting lost or causing him difficulties?’ He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not harmful if he discontinues his Salah (prayer).”’

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: موثق - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (15/243)

narrator_chain.text: الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عَامِرٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ مَهْزِيَارَ عَنْ فَضَالَةَ بْنِ أَيُّوبَ عَنْ أَبَانٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدٍ قَالَ

text: كَانَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) إِذَا وَجَدَ قَمْلَةً فِي الْمَسْجِدِ دَفَنَهَا فِي الْحَصَى .

en.hubeali: Al Husayn Bin Muhammad, from Abdullah Bin Aamir, from Ali Bin Mahziyar, from Fazalat Bin Ayoub, from Aban, from Muhammad who said,
‘It was so that whenever Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> found a louse in the Masjid, buried it among the pebbles’.
en.sarwar: 4. Al-Husayn ibn Muhammad has narrated from ‘Abd Allah ibn ‘Amir, from Ali ibn Mahziyar from Fadalah ibn Ayyub, from Aban from Muhammad who has said the following: “When Abu Ja‘far, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, would see lice in Masjid he would cover it with sand.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مرسل - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (5/243)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنِ الْفَضْلِ بْنِ شَاذَانَ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَمَّنْ أَخْبَرَهُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: إِذَا كُنْتَ فِي صَلَاةِ الْفَرِيضَةِ فَرَأَيْتَ غُلَاماً لَكَ قَدْ أَبَقَ أَوْ غَرِيماً لَكَ عَلَيْهِ مَالٌ أَوْ حَيَّةً تَخَافُهَا عَلَى نَفْسِكَ فَاقْطَعِ الصَّلَاةَ وَ اتْبَعِ الْغُلَامَ أَوْ غَرِيماً لَكَ وَ اقْتُلِ الْحَيَّةَ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Ismail, from Al Fazl Bin Shazaan, from Hammad Bin Isa, from Hareyz, from the one who informed him,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullahasws having said: ‘Whenever you are in the Obligatory Salāt and you see a slave of yours to have absconded, or a debtor of yours upon whom is wealth (due to you), or a snake you fear upon yourself, so cut off your Salāt and pursue the slave, or a debtor of yours, and kill the snake’.
en.sarwar: 5. Muhammad ibn ’Isma‘il has narrated from al-Fadl ibn Shadhan from Hammad ibn ‘Isa from Hariz from those who narrated to him who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘When you are in obligatory Salah (prayer) and see your slave escaping or your debtor who owes you a certain amount of property, or a snake because of which you are afraid for your life, you can discontinue your Salah (prayer) follow the slave or debtor or kill the snake.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مرسل - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (15/243)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ يُونُسَ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: إِنْ وَجَدْتَ قَمْلَةً وَ أَنْتَ تُصَلِّي فَادْفِنْهَا فِي الْحَصَى .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from Muhammad Bin Isa, from Yunus, from Abdullah Bin Sinan,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullahasws having said: ‘If you were to find a louse and you are praying Salāt, so bury it among the pebbles’.
en.sarwar: 6. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from Muhammad ibn ‘Isa from Yunus from ‘Abd Allah ibn Sinan who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘If you see lice in the Masjid when you are in Salah (prayer) cover it in the sand.”
